benchmark_details.name: KwaiChat
benchmark_details.overview: KwaiChat is a human-to-human video-driven multilingual mixed-type dialogue corpus created to facilitate the study of video-driven mixed-type multi-participant dialogue generation. It contains a total of 93,209 videos and 246,080 dialogues across 4 dialogue types, 30 domains, and 4 languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To promote research on video-driven mixed-type multi-participant dialogue generation.

data.source: Collected from a video-sharing platform Kwai

methodology.calculation: BLEU measures are calculated as the ratio of n-grams in the generated response that are present in the reference response; ROUGE-L focuses on the longest common subsequence.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BLEU scores indicate better performance in generating text that matches reference text.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Content that could compromise privacy was removed from the dataset.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Permission was secured to access the data.
